intro: Anisocycla blepharosepala subsp. blepharosepala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anisocycla, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. The flowers are typically tubular with two lips, a feature common in many species of this family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage.
